title: Monzo loses another senior executive
text:
Monzo has lost another senior executive just months after its chief financial officer departed the digital bank in March.

Tom Dolan, the lender's treasurer and former deputy chief financial officer, will join rival banking start-up Cashplus.

Mr Dolan was one of Monzo’s first 20 employees and helped the firm to gain its banking licence in the UK.

His move to Cashplus comes months after Monzo’s veteran finance chief Gary Dolman retired in March.

Monzo replaced Mr Dolman with Alwyn Jones, a former Barclays executive who was its head of retail for international clients.

Cashplus was founded in 2005 and has more than 1.2 million accounts. The business applied for a banking licence in 2017 and hopes...
description: Monzo has lost another senior executive just months after its chief financial officer departed the digital bank in March.
